name: Seminar in Ethical Theory
title: WCAS PHIL 460-0-20 Seminar in Ethical Theory
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for Philosophy PhD Graduate Students

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This seminar will focus on the contractualist moral theory developed by T.M. Scanlon in his book What We Owe to Each Other. We will work through Scanlon's book and consider both critical responses to it as well as more recent developments of the theory by Scanlon and others.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will learn the fundamentals of conractualist moral theory and the main arguments in favor of it as against prominent rival moral theories, such as utilitarianism; they will also gain an understanding of the main criticisms leveled against the theory as well as how contractualists might respond to these criticisms.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be determined primarily on the basis of a Final paper due at the end of term.
